law.text: If, in the settlement of insolvent estates, a party presents a claim against the estate and it is not allowed, he shall pay the cost occasioned thereby, except the attorney's fee. No attorney's fee shall be allowed any claimant in any case against an insolvent estate.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 903.
